intro: Megastachya triticea, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, scale-like leaves. Its flowers are typically wind-pollinated, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Megastachya triticea plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
